meanings.definition: A person who marvels or is amazed.
meanings.sent1: The children were true marvellers at the magic show.
meanings.sent2: The audience members were marvellers at the breathtaking performance.
meanings.sent3: The marvellers gasped in awe as the magician pulled a rabbit out of the hat.
meanings.sent4: She was a marveller, finding wonder in the simplest of things.
meanings.sent5: The marvellers' faces lit up with amazement as the fireworks lit up the night sky.

meanings.definition: Those who are filled with wonder or astonishment.
meanings.sent1: The marvellers stared in disbelief at the incredible sight before them.
meanings.sent2: The group of marvellers couldn't contain their excitement at the surprise party.
meanings.sent3: The marvellers cheered with joy as the unexpected news was announced.
meanings.sent4: Among the marvellers was a young girl with eyes wide in wonder.
meanings.sent5: The marvellers' expressions of astonishment were priceless as they witnessed the magical trick.

meanings.definition: To marvel or be amazed at something.
meanings.sent1: She marvellers at the beauty of nature every time she goes for a walk.
meanings.sent2: The crowd marvellers at the acrobat's incredible balancing act.
meanings.sent3: He marvellers at how fast time flies when he's having fun.
meanings.sent4: The child marvellers at the colorful display of balloons at the fair.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set over the horizon, he couldn't help but marvellers at the stunning colors in the sky.
